etymology.description: 門(門) (mén, "door") + 柬(柬) (jiǎn, "choose") = door with a chosen boundary -> block
etymology.interpretation: The character 闌(闌) (lán, "block") combines the semantic element 門(門) (mén, "door") suggesting an entrance or barrier, with the phonetic element 柬(柬) (jiǎn, "choose"), to indicate blocking or setting boundaries within a doorway.

examples.chinese: 那座低矮的建筑前设有闌(那座低矮的建築前設有闌)，以便阻挡行人(以便阻擋行人)。
examples.pinyin: Nà zuò dī'ǎi de jiànzhú qián shè yǒu lán, yǐbiàn zǔdǎng xíngrén.
examples.english: A barrier was installed before that low building to prevent pedestrians.

examples.chinese: 道路两旁设置了闌(道路兩旁設置了闌)，防止垃圾进入(防止垃圾進入)。
examples.pinyin: Dàolù liǎng páng shèzhì le lán, fángzhǐ lājī jìnrù.
examples.english: Barriers were installed on both sides of the road to keep out trash.
